intro: Erythranthe breviflora, commonly known as the short-flowered erythranthe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Onagraceae. It is native to western North America, particularly found in California and Oregon. This annual herb typically grows in rocky soils and open habitats, such as meadows and coastal bluffs. The plant produces small, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs.
